title: 820-4924 not power on, orange/green light.
message: so, i got this machine as water damage there is no sign of it, inside the machine. i took out the board and made some measurements. ppbus, is 12.64v, i checked data lines, they are open. i checked smc_reset_l, and its fluctuating. pm_battlow_l is fluctuating too. my suspect is that the SMC is damaged, but i dont wanna mess with it, whitout a second opinion. so do i reball/replace SMC or where do i check?

title: 820-4924 not power on, orange/green light.
message:
PPBUS_G3H and 3V42 steady voltages?
You must get stable SMC_RESET_L signal.
Check U5110 area and post its voltages.
Test disconnecting TP/KB cables too.

title: 820-4924 not power on, orange/green light.
message:
PPBUS_G3H fluctuating between 12.55v and 12.66v. 3vs42 stable at 3.42v. SMC_RESET_L is at 2.34v.

As for U5110

pin 1 - 3.42v
pin 2- 0v
pin 3-3.42v
pin 4- 3.30v
pin 5-2.16v
pin 6- 3.10v
pin 7-3.42v
pin 8-3.31v

title: 820-4924 not power on, orange/green light.
message: TP and KB are disconnected of course!

title: 820-4924 not power on, orange/green light.
message:
Not too much things connected there.
First be sure R5100 is not affected by corrosion.
Next remove R7100 and see if SMC_RESET_L goes high.
J6100 is suspect too; you may need to clean, or remove it.
If still the same, change U5110.
For the last remains SMC.
You can try reballing it first...

title: 820-4924 not power on, orange/green light.
message: resoldered r5100 to make sure it has good contact with pads. removed r7100, smc reset l increased to 3.12v....

title: 820-4924 not power on, orange/green light.
message: If you get steady high SMC_RESET_L without R7100, then replace U7100.

title: 820-4924 not power on, orange/green light.
message: i did all you told me to before messing with the smc......then i reflowed smc, and board is now dead haha. i guess ill have to get some scraps board go replace it. and a new stencil, the one i have its bent...ill update once i get everything i need to fix this.

title: 820-4924 not power on, orange/green light.
message:
If SMC_REESET_L went high after R7100 removed, didn't test if board starts that time?
I hoped you make the mentioned steps one by one.

Try to reball SMC again.
Use solder paste, not balls...
